alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 6:59PM EST until January 07 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches, with localized amounts up to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 AM EST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to 3 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may fall at 1 inch or greater per hour later this evening. Visibility will drop down to one quarter mile or less during the heaviest snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
